content:
It would nice to have dark mode our portico pages also
I like how Android 10 websites changes its screenshots when we toggle b/w themes
It would definitely be a lot of work but I guess its worth to take a look into this

I think a higher priority one would probably be to migrate /help and /api pages to use dark more. That should be easier as well. I think our portico pages are in general less annoying to the eyes compared to /help pages which has a white background.

I also like how the android screenshots switches to dark mode when the website is toggled to dark mode. It's pretty cool. Though I don't think whether we have the resources to focus on this at the moment :)
For /help and /api pages should we match the theme with our main app or give a separate toggle to change the theme on those pages?

I think its a bit tricky. Many users for example open help pages in zulip.com/help instead of going for subdomain.zulip.com/help. So we should have an option to toggle which defaults to the value of the user preference I think if there is an organization present.
Probably easier to just give the user a toggle and decouple it from the main web app. And we save the preference in browser cache.
I guess /stats can have the dark theme that can match with the main app
